text: After the death of Saul, when David had returned from defeating the Amalekites, he stayed at Ziklag for two days.
On the third day a man arrived from the camp of Saul with his clothes torn and dirt on his head. When he approached David, the man threw himself to the ground.
David asked him, “Where are you coming from?” He replied, “I have escaped from the camp of Israel.”

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">inquired</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">How</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">things</st> going?<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05046 04994">Tell</st> me!” He <st data-num="0559 0834">replied</st>, “The <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="05127" class="">fled</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">and</st> <st data-num="07235" class="">many</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">them</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05307" class="">fell</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="01571" class="">Even</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">are dead</st>!”

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st><n id="1" /> who was <st data-num="05046" class="">telling</st> him this, “<st data-num="0349" class="">How</st> do you <st data-num="03045" class="">know</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> and his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="04191">are dead</st>?”<n id="2" />

The <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “I <st data-num="07122" class="">just</st> <st data-num="07136" class="">happened</st> to be on <st data-num="02022" class="">Mount</st> <st data-num="01533" class="">Gilboa</st> and <st data-num="02009" class="">came across</st> <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="08172" class="">leaning</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st> for support. The <st data-num="02009 07393">chariots</st> and <st data-num="01167" class="">leaders</st> of the <st data-num="06571" class="">horsemen</st> <st data-num="01692" class="">were in hot pursuit of</st> him.

When he <st data-num="06437" class="">turned</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">around</st> and <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> me, he <st data-num="07121" class="">called out</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me. I <st data-num="0559" class="">answered</st>, ‘<st data-num="02005" class="">Here</st> I am!’

He <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st> me, ‘<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> are <st data-num="0859" class="">you?’</st> I <st data-num="0559 0413">told</st> him, ‘<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st>’m<n id="1" /> an <st data-num="06003">Amalekite</st>.’

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, ‘<st data-num="05975 04994">Stand</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> me and <st data-num="04191" class="">finish</st> me <st data-num="04191" class="">off</st>!<n id="1" /> I<st data-num="03588 0270">’m very</st> <st data-num="07661" class="">dizzy</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">even though</st> I’m <st data-num="05750" class="">still</st> <st data-num="03605 05315">alive</st>.’<n id="3" />

So I stood over him and put him to death, since I knew that he couldn’t live in such a condition. Then I took the crown which was on his head and the bracelet which was on his arm. I have brought them here to my lord.”
David then grabbed his own clothes and tore them, as did all the men who were with him.
They lamented and wept and fasted until evening because Saul, his son Jonathan, the Lord’s army, and the house of Israel had fallen by the sword.
David said to the young man who told this to him, “Where are you from?” He replied, “I am an Amalekite, the son of a resident foreigner.”
David replied to him, “How is it that you were not afraid to reach out your hand to destroy the Lord’s anointed?”

Then <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="05288" class="">soldiers</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="05066" class="">Come here</st> and <st data-num="06293" class="">strike</st> him <st data-num="06293" class="">down</st>!” So he <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> him <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>, and he <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>.
David said to him, “Your blood be on your own head! Your own mouth has testified against you, saying ‘I have put the Lord’s anointed to death.’”
Then David chanted this lament over Saul and his son Jonathan.
(He gave instructions that the people of Judah should be taught “The Bow.” Indeed, it is written down in the Scroll of the Upright One.)

“The beauty of Israel lies slain on your high places!

How the mighty have fallen!

Don’t report it in Gath,

don’t spread the news in the streets of Ashkelon,

or the daughters of the Philistines will rejoice,

the daughters of the uncircumcised will celebrate!

O mountains of Gilboa,

may there be no dew or rain on you, nor fields of grain offerings!

For it was there that the shield of warriors was defiled;

the shield of Saul lies neglected without oil.

From the blood of the slain, from the fat of warriors,

the bow of Jonathan was not turned away.

The sword of Saul never returned empty.

Saul and Jonathan were greatly loved during their lives,

and not even in their deaths were they separated.

They were swifter than eagles, stronger than lions.

O daughters of Israel, weep over Saul,

who clothed you in scarlet as well as jewelry,

who put gold jewelry on your clothes.

How the warriors have fallen

in the midst of battle!

Jonathan lies slain on your high places!

I grieve over you, my brother Jonathan.

You were very dear to me.

Your love was more special to me than the love of women.

How the warriors have fallen!

The weapons of war are destroyed!”
